meanings.definition: The act of igniting or setting on fire before the expected time.
meanings.sent1: The preignitions of the fireworks startled the audience.
meanings.sent2: The preignitions of the campfire caused a safety concern.
meanings.sent3: The preignitions of the birthday candles made the cake look magical.
meanings.sent4: The preignitions of the engine symbolized unexpected excitement.
meanings.sent5: The preignitions of the bonfire lit up the night sky beautifully.

meanings.definition: A sudden burst of ignition or combustion before the intended moment.
meanings.sent1: The preignitions of the car engine surprised everyone nearby.
meanings.sent2: The preignitions of the fireworks startled the children.
meanings.sent3: The preignitions of the stove burner made the chef jump in surprise.
meanings.sent4: The preignitions of the rocket launch added an element of danger.
meanings.sent5: The preignitions of the candle flame flickered erratically.
